availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Newton Webb (Henry County, KY, attorney, judge, hotelkeeper, and KY House Rep)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky attorney, hotelkeeper, judge, and politician. Son of Waller Webb and Hannah Young. Attended Hanover College in Hanover, Indiana. Married to Levian Gist Webb in 1847. Father of John G. Webb, Minnie Webb, Sallie Webb, Mary Webb, I. Newton Webb, Washington Irving Webb and Waller Webb. Attorney in Henry County. Judge pro tempore in Henry County in 1862. Hotelkeeper in Cynthiana, Kentucky, in 1864. Elected to the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1865. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860.
